D1.name: Backup data, which can be written with user data
D1.comment: They are only reset by backup domain reset (BDRST) or by a TAMPER pin event (if the TAMPER pin function is activated).

CAL.name: Calibration value
CAL.comment: The value indicates the number of clock pulses that will be skipped every 2^20 clock pulses. This allows the calibration of the RTC clock. The clock can be slowed down from 0 to 121 ppm.

CCO.name: Calibration clock output selection

values.1: TAMPER pin output RTC clock divided by 64.

CCO.comment:
The tamper detection function must be switched off to enable this function.
This bit is cleared when VDD power supply is switched off.

ASOE.name: TAMPER pin alarm/second output enable
ASOE.comment: This bit can only be reset by backup domain reset (BDRST).

ASOS.name: TAMPER pin alarm/second output selection
ASOS.comment: This bit can only be reset by backup domain reset (BDRST).

TPE.name: TAMPER pin enable

values.0: TAMPER pin used as common IO port.
values.1: TAMPER pin used for the tamper detection.

TPE.comment: When the TPAL and TPE bits are cleared at the same time, a false tamper event occurs. It is recommended to change the status of the TPAL bit only when TPE is 0.

TPAL.name: TAMPER pin active level

values.0: High level on the TAMPER pin cause all backup data registers cleared (hardware lock rising edge).
values.1: Low level on the TAMPER pin causer all backup data registers cleared (hardware lock falling edge).

TPAL.comment: When the TPAL and TPE bits are cleared at the same time, a false tamper event occurs. It is recommended to change the status of the TPAL bit only when TPE is 0.

CTE.name: Clear Tamper detection event
CTE.comment: Write 1 to clear it, and the value read out is invalid.

CTI.name: Clear Tamper detection interrupt
CTI.comment: Write 1 to clear it, and the value read out is invalid.

TPIE.name: Tamper interrupt enable

values.1: Tamper detection interrupt enabled (TPE needs to be set to 1).

TPIE.comment:
The tamper detection interrupt cannot wake up the core from low-power mode.
This bit is reset only when the system is reset or woken up from standby mode.

TEF.name: Tamper event flag
TEF.comment:
When a tamper event is detected, this bit is set. Cleared by writing 1 to the CTE bit.
When this bit is 1, all BKP_DATARx registers are cleared, and all write operations to the BKP_DATARx register are invalid before this bit is not reset.

TIF.name: Tamper interrupt flag
TIF.comment:
When a tamper event is detected and the TPIE bit is set to 1, this bit is set. Cleared by writing 1 to the CTI bit. If the TPIE bit is reset, this bit is reset at the same time.
This bit is reset only when the system is reset or woken up from standby mode.
